title.narrative: Ensuring learning continuity in the context of COVID-19 pandemic in Zambezia

description.narrative: This project aims to mitigate the negative effects of the schools closure by providing user-friendly self-learning material for children who don't have access to distance learning programs and putting in place monitoring tools to access and follow-up children's educational progress.The project will target about 8000 children including the most vulnerable children, aged 10-13 years in grade 5 and 7, training of 400 teachers from 322 schools in the districts of Murrumbala and Milange in the production and use of the self-learning material and monitoring tools and raising of awareness on COVID 19 preventive measures.

title.narrative: COVID-19 Accelerated Funding for the Education Sector in Zimbabwe

description.narrative: The project aims to reach out to vulnerable girls and boys in targeted areas to continue learning during the COVID-19 Pandemic through accessing alternative learning programmes at home. Thus, the project will strengthen digital learning (with and without internet) for learners and teachers including identification of platforms for e-learning such as Ruzivo, IoGT, Learning Passport, etc, factoring in needs of children with disabilities. This is in addition to development of e-learning materials for primary and secondary education learners and building the of a core of teachers in delivering and supporting remote and e-learning.

description.narrative: As part of the Covid-19 response,this project will bring WHO and UNESCO's strengths into a multi-layered approach aiming to achieve two overall objectives: • Journalists trained over six months through regular interactive briefings with experts and mentors • Citizens have access to accurate and understandable information on #CoronavirusFacts. The project also aims to enhance radio producers' capacity to ensure continuity of their work in case of confinement or financial difficulties, thus ensuring misinformation will continue to be countered by information.

description.narrative: The overall goal of the UNAIDS and Russian Federation supported Regional Cooperation Programme is to strengthen capacities of EECA countries in effective HIV/AIDS prevention. During 2020, UNESCO will support:(1) HIV and COVID-19 awareness raising, reduction of HIV/COVID- related stigma and discrimination, building young people's social and personal skills and resilience through youth-serving interactive online platforms; (2) strengthening teachers' capacity to deliver good quality HIV/SRHR education within the context of wider health education addressing also new emerging threats like COVID-19 through teacher training, curriculum and learning materials development.

title.narrative: Enhancing Access to Distance Learning for the Most Vulnerable Children in Iraq

description.narrative: This 7-month project aims to increase access to formal and non-formal education for the students who lost physical access to education by the school closure due to COVID 19, in particular children who are most vulnerable and marginalised. It aims to reach 60,000 children in the out-of-camp locations who may not have access to e-learning platforms in response to the COVID 19 crisis. This will be achieved through supporting the development of educational contents of Federal Ministry of Education (MoE)'s Education TV channel and ensuring students and children's access to TV education and support by their caretakers in their learning.

title.narrative: Appui à la riposte au COVID-19 au Cameroun, à travers les radios communautaires

description.narrative: Les interventions proposées dans le cadre de ce projet visent à renforcer la contribution des médias communautaires du Cameroun à la réponse au COVID-19. Le projet contribuera à renforcer les capacités 40 radios communautaires à produire et à diffuser des informations fiables, des contenus factuels et culturellement pertinents sur le Covid-19. Il s'agira également de renforcer les mécanismes de collaboration entre les médias communautaires et leurs communautés respectives par la création et l'animation de 120 clubs d'écoute. Par ailleurs le projet permettra aussi de faire le plaidoyer sur la viabilité et la soutenabilité des média communautaires camerounais.

title.narrative: COVID-19: inclusive education and digital environments

description.narrative: As an immediate response to the COVID-19 outbreak, the project aims to provide educational leaders, administrators and teachers with concrete knowledge and skills as well as appropriate tools and resources to make education more accessible and inclusive to all learners. A special attention will be placed on the application of the Open and Distance Learning as one of the most sustainable methods for overcoming the educational barriers faced by persons with disabilities during the emergency situations. The ODL is also considered to be a more sustainable method for overcoming the educational barriers in a long term. The inter-sectoral project will be implemented by CI, SHS, ED and IIEP.

title.narrative: Re-imagining Education for marginalized girls and boys during and post Covid-19 in Bosnia and Herzegovina

description.narrative: This joint programme proposal is an integral part of the UN Socio-economic Response Plan in BiH, which holistically addresses immediate and intermediate consequences of the COVID-19 pandemic and enables synergies of different sectors to achieve more inclusive and more resilient society. This proposal is designed to contribute in a straightforward and comprehensive way to minimising the immediate socio-economic consequences emerging due to educational disruption in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic. The proposed interventions will also point at decreasing the immediate risks of dropping-out and having out-of-school children in case the regular education is disrupted.

title.narrative: Strengthening Education Sector Response to COVID-19 Pandemic in Mongolia

description.narrative: The UN joint project aims to support the Government of Mongolia to implement the national COVID-19 preparedness and response plan by focusing on critical education and health services delivery. The emergency response UN project will support immediate education sector interventions to address the school closures. The UN will assist and support the Ministry of Education (MECSS) to ensure continuity and accessibility of quality basic on-line education services for children, adolescences, and youth, including those with disabilities and from ethnic minorities, which was interrupted by COVID-19 pandemic. The UN project will be jointly implemented by WHO, UNESCO, UNICEF and UNFPA.

title.narrative: UN COVID-19 MPTF: Immediate UN Response for coherent safeguarding the livelihoods of people made most vulnerable by COVID-19 in Nepal

description.narrative: In response to the impact of COVID-19, the project aims to safeguard peoples' livelihoods through immediate employment generation and financial security of informal sector workers, mostly women, including internal migrants and migrant workers returning from abroad, and women's cooperatives. In addition, the project also envisages to design, develop, and roll-out cash for work for vulnerable community members, including migrants, women, Dalits, and workers in the tourism sector and to provide technical assistance to the planning, design and roll-out of targeted short-term vocational and skill training. The project is being implemented by UNESCO, along with UNDP, ILO and IOM.

title.narrative: Inclusive Economic Recovery through Sustainable Enterprises in the Informal Economies of Fiji, Palau, Tonga and Vanuatu

description.narrative: A Joint UN project with a focus on strengthening the informal economy, including the cultural and creative industries. The intervention addresses unemployment and aims to support sustainable enterprises in the informal sub-sectors following the impact of COVID-19. The local informal creative industries, mostly operating as micro home-based enterprises, have been particularly affected by the contraction of the tourism sector. The project will aim to strengthen the cultural industries, and capitalize on local creative talent through specialized skills transfer, market linkages, and by addressing pre-existing challenges in the structure and mechanisms of the informal economy.

title.narrative: Promoting the Safeguarding of Intangible Cultural Heritage and South-South Cooperation in Bolivia, Colombia, Ecuador and Venezuela

description.narrative: Regarding the four States Parties that compose the cluster, all of them are to submit their periodic reports in 2020 (regional reporting cycle LAC in 2020). In this context, the Quito Office provided technical assistance and support to the four States, with a focus on assisting Bolivia, due to the recent creation of the Ministry of Cultures, Decolonization and Depatriarchalization. In the context of the COVID-19 pandemic, the Quito Office organized four webinars focussed on women and ICH, in order to better mainstream gender issues in ICH discussions. Besides, in 2021, the Quito Office will support countries of the cluster in promoting policies that articulate ICH and economic empowerment of vulnerable communities.

title.narrative: Inclusive education for out of school children and youth in Central America

description.narrative: Despite considerable progress in access to and participation in education, in 2017 there were still 5 million children and adolescents who did not attend school in Central America due to a variety of reasons. Given the specific context of COVID that affected the education systems concerning most vulnerable populations in Central America, UNESCO will provide technical assistance to Ministries of Education in a proposal of monitoring, evaluation and transition post covid adjusted for each country with focus on excludes populations.

title.narrative: Reinforcing policies for community participation in World Heritage sites in the cluster

description.narrative:
The main activity will be reoriented to tackle the new challenges brought by the COVID-19 pandemic as regards site management, with a specific focus on community participation. In the first semester 2021, a specific activity related to the impact of COVID-19 on the livelihoods of communities in and around World Heritage sites, to be selected by States Parties. The main objective is to draw on interesting and complementary experiences concerning effects and measures taken to manage the COVID-19 pandemic. Considering the current emergency, a second dimension to be tackled will be education and heritage.
The activity will aim at promoting cooperation and exchange of experiences among the countries of the cluster.

title.narrative: Support pour la mise en oeuvre de la Convention de 1972 en Haïti: "Ripos Nò Korona - PNH CSSR sans Covid-19"

description.narrative: Cette activité a pour but de soutenir la mise en œuvre de la Convention de 1972 en Haïti, en étroite collaboration avec le Centre du patrimoine mondial, conformément aux décisions du Comité du Patrimoine mondial et selon les priorités du Plan d'action du Patrimoine mondial en Amérique latine et les Caraïbes. Une attention particulière sera consacrée à l'association des communautés dans la gestion du Patrimoine mondial et à la sensibilisation du grand public d'Haïti, des femmes et des hommes issus de la société civile, des communautés locales, des jeunes, D'une manière générale l'activité facilitera l'intégration, la diversité culturelle et le respect de l'environnement dans l'élaboration des politiques publiques au développement.

title.narrative: Caribbean Artificial Intelligence Initiative in the context COVID-19

description.narrative: This project will benefit Caribbean Small Island Developing States (SIDS) by providing capacity building webinars on Artificial Intelligence (AI) in the context of the COVID-19 crisis. Implemented by UNESCO Kingston Office in partnership with the Broadcasting Commission of Jamaica, the project aims to build the capacity of participants to cope with the COVID-19 crisis. The webinars will especially consider the Caribbean context and discuss how to harness the potential of AI to accelerate sustainable development in Small Island Developing States (SIDS).

title.narrative: CapED Programme - Education Response to the COVID-19 crisis

description.narrative: The CapED Programme is an extrabudgetary programme created in 2003 based on the understanding that education reforms will not be effective if countries lack the capacities to make them operational. With an overarching capacity development approach, CapED seeks to improve the quality of education and increase learning opportunities, especially for girls and women and disadvantaged population groups. Under "Education Response to the COVID-19 crisis", CapED will address urgent needs to respond to school closures and ensure continuity of learning through distance-learning modalities and crisis-sensitive, contingency planning.

title.narrative: Strengthening the responsiveness, agility and resilience of TVET institutions in the post-COVID-19 (December 2020 - June 2021) era

description.narrative: The project is conceived to help alleviate the immediate, mid- and long-term effects of the global COVID-19 crisis to learning and employment by providing TVET institutions and training providers with opportunities to mitigate the impact of the pandemic and sustaining their efforts in curbing the long-term effect of the pandemic. TVET Institutions will be supported in managing relevant and immediate skill development programmes , and in raising their institutional capacity to deliver new digital services and to adopt developed tools that are useful in establishing institutional resilience in the post-COVID-19 era.

title.narrative: Reviving Mosul and Basra Old Cities_Phase Two

description.narrative: This project was prepared as a response to Covid-19 and its socio-economic impact in Iraq. The overall objective of this project is to contribute to economic recovery as well as to social cohesion through creation of decent jobs in re-construction of historical urban centres of Mosul and Basra as well as support to Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) active in various sectors and the cultural and creative industries through a financing mechanism. It will build up on the ongoing activities in both cities implemented by UNESCO and IOM in order to provide a quick response to the pandemic and ensure immediate impact on local economies.

description.narrative: The project is part of the "peace and reconciliation agreement in Mali" resulting from the Algiers process in which the signatory parties express their attachment to the recognition and promotion of cultural diversity. The general objective of the project is to support the Government of Mali through cultural actors and the education system in the exploitation and promotion of knowledge and know-how, the revitalization of the mechanisms of traditional crisis management and provide significant support in its fight against Covid-19. title.narrative: Burkina Faso et Mali: Création d’emplois équitables et développement durable de microentreprises dans les chaines de valeur liées au secteur du « lifestyle »

description.narrative: Le projet a pour but de contribuer au développement économique et à l’emploi dans le secteur artisanal au Burkina Faso et au Mali et ainsi réduire la pression migratoire au sein de ces pays, en luttant contre les causes profondes des phénomènes de déstabilisation et ce, en offrant des possibilités de formation et en favorisant la création d’emplois dignes, durables et équitablement rémunérés respectant les normes du Fair Labour Association (FLA - Association pour le Travail Equitable en français). Au sein de l'International Trade Centre (ITC), le projet sera mis en place par l'équipe de l’Ethical Fashion Initiative (EFI) qui a pour but de contribuer à la réduction de la pauvreté en permettant à des artisans marginalisés de pays en voie de développement de s’insérer dans le marché international du « lifestyle » qui comprend, la mode, la décoration intérieur, l’ameublement et les industries créatives. EFI a lancé un projet de promotion à l’international du tissage artisanal du coton au Burkina Faso et au Mali de 2013 à 2016 et ce projet a obtenu de très bons résultats. Le projet présenté ici constitue la Phase II de l’intervention de EFI dans la chaine de valeur du tissage. Ce projet a pour but d’étendre significativement le nombre de bénéficiaires, en contribuant à la création et la stabilisation de 4650 emplois justement rémunérés et durables au Burkina Faso et au Mali, mais surtout d’adresser la problématique de l’émigration en ayant comme populations cibles les personnes susceptibles de migrer (en particulier les jeunes), les migrants de retour dans leurs pays d’origine après expulsion et des demandeurs d’asile en Europe potentiellement candidats aux programmes de Retours Volontaires Assistés (RVA). Le projet interviendra tout au long de la chaine de valeur du tissage artisanal, de l’égrenage du coton à la transformation des tissus en produits finis. Il apportera des débouchées dans le secteur du « lifestyle » qui comprend la mode mais aussi l’aménagement et la décoration d’intérieur. Au Burkina Faso le projet opère à travers une entreprise sociale dénommée Groupement d’Intérêt Economique « Commerce et Artisanat pour le Bien-Être Social », GIE CABES en abrégé Au Mali le Projet a du integrer la recrudescence des problèmes sécuritaires , des violences intracommunautaires et des personnes déplacées. Une stratégie de decentralisation a été necessaire à travers l’activation d’atelier-pilote incubateurs d’inclusion de micro-entrepreneur/artisan auto-employé start up et de la moyenne entreprise selon une dimension regionale/cluster et par chaine de valeur à avantage compétitif liées à l’E-Commerce . Une cooperative consortium export/entreprise sociale interface unique est prévue en option exit strategy . Les entreprises sociales contextualisent le modèle d’intervention standard de EFI à travers le repérage, l’identification et l’organisation et la délivrance de l’assistance technique spécialisée à ces micro et très petites entreprises indépendantes déjà constituées, avec des artisans talentueux (mais assez souvent informelles et inconnues des autorités fiscales), afin de mettre en commun leurs faibles moyens, leur permettre de réduire leurs charges, de développer une offre complète, crédible et de qualité pour les acheteurs, régionaux, internationaux et ainsi d’accroitre leurs revenus issus des exportations. La nouvelle Pandémie du COVID-19 a comporté des impacts déjà négatifs, donc des ajustements budgétaires force majeure sont necéssaires, pour réorienter et adapter de nouvelles innovations dans les modalités de l’assistance technique, et dans les outils de connexion durables aux marchés au niveau national, regional et international. Le Donateur accordera une extension de 12 mois supplementaires pour les mesures attenuant la reprise de la crise économique et sociale, et le rallentissement des echanges commerciaux.

reporting-org.narrative: Asian Development Bank

title.narrative: Air Quality Improvement in the Greater Beijing–Tianjin–Hebei Region–Green Financing Scale up Project

description.narrative: The proposed project uses the financial intermediation loan modality, which is the best fit to support geographically scattered investments while maximizing ADB's loan leveraging capacity through revolving the loan fund and mobilizing domestic funds. It aims to address emerging challenges in air quality improvement and GHG emission reduction in both the greater BTH and YRD regions through energy efficiency, cleaner transport systems development, renewable energy development, and cooling systems retrofit. It also stimulates post COVID-19 recovery investment with build-back-better principles by continuously scaling up clean energy technologies and systems applications in the targeted regions, which account for around 50% of the gross domestic product in the PRC. The project will support key strategic pillars of ADB's Strategy 2030: (i) tackling climate change, building climate and disaster resilience, and enhancing environmental sustainability by accelerating low greenhouse gas emissions development and ensuring environmental sustainability; (ii) strengthening governance and institutional capacity by providing inclusive financial services for clean energy investment; and (iii) accelerating progress in achieving gender equality through gender mainstreaming activities.

reporting-org.narrative: Asian Development Bank

title.narrative: COVID-19: Second Health System Enhancement to Address and Limit COVID-19 under the Asia Pacific Vaccine Access Facility

description.narrative:
The proposed loan to the Republic of the Philippines for the Second Health System Enhancement to Address and Limit COVID-19 under the Asia Pacific Vaccine Access Facility (HEAL 2). Under the rapid response component (RRC) of the Asia Pacific Vaccine Access Facility (APVAX), will provide the Government of the Philippines with timely financing for safe and effective vaccine procurement and logistics, based on an agreed list of eligible expenditures. It will supplement the initial support of the Asian Development Bank (ADB) to the government's coronavirus disease (COVID-19) response under the Health System Enhancement to Address and Limit COVID-19 (HEAL) project. HEAL 2 is aligned with three operational priorities of ADB's Strategy 2030: (i) addressing remaining poverty and reducing inequalities; (ii) accelerating progress in gender equality; and (iii) fostering regional cooperation and integration.
The Philippines has met all APVAX access criteria by (i) demonstrating the adverse impact of the COVID-19 pandemic; (ii) completing a needs assessment and a vaccination allocation and prioritization plan, including an incremental medical waste management plan and procurement arrangements acceptable to ADB, with ADB's receipt of a Governor's letter confirming its commitment to implement the plan and ensure compliance with the APVAX vaccine eligibility criteria; and (iii) establishing an effective development partner coordination mechanism with a clear role for ADB

reporting-org.narrative: Asian Development Bank

title.narrative: COVID-19: Strengthening Health Security Program (Subprogram 1)

description.narrative: The proposed program aims to strengthen the health sector's response to the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic and expedite the medium-term reforms that will strengthen the health system and help Mongolia become better prepared to respond to future health crises. The program's design draws on the operational knowledge that the Asian Development Bank (ADB) has gained through its engagement in the health sector in Mongolia since 1993. Through a strategic, coordinated, and well-sequenced set of policy actions, the program will facilitate both immediate and critical medium-term reforms. The provision of a $100 million loan will directly contribute to address the urgent financing needs of the Government of Mongolia. Four reform areas identified under the program will focus on (i) strengthening planning and preparedness of the health sector, and ensuring the availability of critical medicines and emergency supplies; (ii) improving national pharmaceutical regulation, and increasing hospital autonomy and good governance; (iii) enhancing procurement in the health sector to increase efficiency, and establishing a single purchaser for health services; and (iv) safeguarding fiscal sustainability of the government over the medium term (3-5 years).

reporting-org.narrative: Asian Development Bank

title.narrative: COVID-19: Emergency Response Project

description.narrative:
The proposed project is part of a comprehensive ADB package which also includes budget support for the COVID-19 Active Response and Expenditure Support (CARES) Program. The proposed project will be co-financed by ADB and AIIB to urgently increase Uzbekistan's resilience to COVID-19 pandemics and other epidemics. The project will support the testing, surveillance, and case management of COVID-19 in Uzbekistan by equipping and refurbishing the national laboratory system, establishing an IT-based national surveillance and monitoring system, and improving and expanding the COVID-19 treatment capacity. Activities will be coordinated with, and complementary to, assistance of the World Bank, the United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the United States Agency for International Development (USAID), and fill remaining gaps in medical equipment and supplies.
The proposed project is aligned with four operational priorities of Strategy 2030: (i) addressing poverty and reducing inequalities through improved health access; (ii) accelerating gender equality through occupational safety and training targets for women; (iii) strengthening governance and institutional capacity; and (iv) fostering regional cooperation through reducing risks of cross-border disease transmission. The project further aligns with Uzbekistan's National Actions Strategy for 20172021, and the government-adopted "The Concept of Development of the Healthcare System of the Republic of Uzbekistan for 20192025." Reforms will address systematic health systems issues such as fragmentation, inefficiency, and the insufficient emphasis on non-communicable diseases prevention and early detection.
The project is aligned with (i) concept for the development of the health system of the Republic of Uzbekistan for 20192025, and (ii) the SPRP. The project will have the following outcome: resilience to outbreaks of COVID-19 and other epidemics reinforced. The project will have three outputs: Output 1 - national laboratory system strengthened; Output 2 - national surveillance and response system established for COVID-19 and other epidemics; and Output 3 - COVID-19 treatment capacity expanded.

description.narrative: 1) To conduct a participatory gap analysis of the current national legal and policy frameworks in selected countries and develop a roadmap to legal and policy reforms needed to strengthen national pandemic preparedness and response. 2) Based on the findings of the participatory gap-analysis and roadmap, to support the development of technical assistance plans to define and guide IDLO’s technical support to countries. 3) To deliver technical assistance and provide preliminary capacity development support to government and non-governmental stakeholders to enhance the necessary legal and policy reforms.

The project aims to contribute to the ‘UN Framework for the immediate socio-economic response to COVID-19’, by supporting countries in strengthening national legal and policy frameworks on preparedness and responses to public health emergencies.

title.narrative: Pandemic Preparedness and Response Project

reporting-org.narrative: International Development Law Organization (IDLO)

title.narrative: Mongolia: Mitigating the Impact of COVID-19 by Increasing Children's Access to Justice

description.narrative: 1) To strengthen the capacity of Legal Committees on Child Rights (LCCRs) to increase child access to justice in the context of COVID-19. 2) To increase accreditation of civil society organizations (CSOs) to provide services for children. 3) To increase awareness of the child protection and child rights framework by children, families, and communities.

Direct beneficiaries: Authority for Family, Children and Youth Development (AFCYD), National Police Agency (NPA) Child Protection Division of the Crime Prevention Unit (CPU), CSOs, particularly those in Western and Eastern regions of Mongolia. Indirect beneficiaries: Vulnerable populations especially children, families and communities.
The project aims to increase protection and access to justice for children, especially child victims of violence and those at risk in the context of COVID-19

title.narrative: Kyrgyzstan: Commercial Mediation in the Kyrgyz Republic (Phase 2): COVID-19 Response

description.narrative: 1) To introduce online mediation for efficient resolving of commercial disputes during and post the COVID-19 period and make mediators a viable alternative to courts. 2) To strengthen capacity building of key players (such as mediators and judges) on online commercial mediation to encourage them to refer mediable disputes to mediation. 3) To involve the business community, in particular SMEs, by means of a targeted mediation awareness raising campaign and piloting mediation.

Direct beneficiaries: The Supreme Court of the Kyrgyz Republic (SC), the High Justice Training Centre (HJTC) under the SC, the Republican Community of Mediators of the Kyrgyz Republic (RCM) and Mediation Centers, Kyrgyz mediators and SMEs.

The project aims to assist the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic with promoting and facilitating the use of commercial mediation to small and medium enterprises (SMEs), specifically during and post the COVID-19 pandemic period, with the goal of making the use of mediation, including online mediation, a business norm in the Kyrgyz Republic.

title.narrative: Tajikistan: Commercial Mediation - Phase 3: COVID-19 Response: Support with Adoption of the Law on Mediation and Promotion of Commercial Mediation to Small- and Medium-Sized Enterprises (SMEs)

description.narrative: 1) To enable the Working Group on Development of the Law on Mediation of the Republic of Tajikistan to finalize the draft and adopt the Law. 2) To carry out awareness-raising campaigns and to pilot mediation. 3) To introduce online mediation for efficient resolving of commercial disputes during and post COVID-19 period and for making mediators a viable alternative to courts. 4) To involve the business community, in particular SMEs, by means of a targeted mediation awareness-raising campaign and piloting mediation.

The project aims to assist the Government of the Republic of Tajikistan with the adoption of the Law on Mediation and promoting and facilitating the use of commercial mediation to SMEs, specifically during and post the COVID-19 pandemic period, with the goal of making the use of mediation, including online mediation, a business norm in the Republic of Tajikistan.

title.narrative: Humanitarian Assistance including Mental Health and Psychological Support (MHPSS) and Government and Community Site Management in Displacement-Affected Locations in Ethiopia

description.narrative: IOM provides joint site management support (SMS) assistance and mental health and psychosocial support (MHPSS) in displacement affected locations in Oromia and Dire Dawa regions of Ethiopia, as well as MHPSS in quarantine centers in Addis Ababa. Within the context of the COVID-19 pandemic, SMS teams are focusing on risk communication and continuation of MHPSS and case management services. IOM is also providing capacity-building to frontline workers and service providers.

title.narrative: Fostering Local Communities of Solidarity for Migrants and Refugees from Venezuela

description.narrative: In response to the Venezuelan migrant and refugee crisis in the Latin American region, IOM, UNHCR and UNHabitat will support cities to strengthen their policies on the social and economic integration, working closely with migrants, refugees and host communities to promote social cohesion, equal access to services and the guarantee of human rights. This initiative will be looking at migration and refugee policies from a comprehensive local sustainable development perspective considering the consequences of the COVID-19 pandemic on migrants' and refugees' coping mechanisms and livelihoods, combining the mandates and experiences of three UN agencies. In addition, cities of implementation will be Barranquilla and Cucutá - Colombia, Lima - Peru, Quito - Ecuador, and Santo Domingo - Dominican Republic.

title.narrative: Mitigating Socioeconomic Effects of the COVID-19 Pandemic on Migrants and Communities in Central Asia and the Russian Federation

description.narrative: The proposed project seeks to contribute to the achievement of the objective of mitigating socioeconomic effects of the COVID-19 pandemic on migrants and communities. The project is in line with the Sub-Regional Appeal: IOM Central Asia and the Russian Federation Strategic Preparedness and Response Plan. It is expected that this initiative will contribute to the efforts of the Governments of the Central Asian states - the Republics of Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan, Uzbekistan, and the Russian Federation in meeting the growing operational challenges of migration management in the current global health crisis situation.

title.narrative: Progressing the Revival of Women Entrepreneurs for Strengthened Economic Empowerment in the Republic of the Marshall Islands

description.narrative: This project contributes to strengthening of economic empowerment in the Republic of the Marshall Islands (RMI) through the continued revival of Women Entrepreneurs (WE), a members' network established in 2013 through “Women United Together Marshall Islands”. IOM will provide continued human resource, technical support and resources to the revival of the network, through secondment of a dedicated network staff as well as lead the implementation of the WE strategic plan. A number of new activities will also be rolled out including community outreach and network development on Ebeye and the outer islands, intensive business management training courses for all members, provision of laptop and internet access for members use at a co-working space, showcase events and the creation of an e-commerce platform for members. These activities will also support the enduring challenges faced by women to start or grow their business in the RMI under the threat of COVID-19.

title.narrative: Support for the Mobilization of Young People, Actors of Social Cohesion and Peace in the Center North and Sahel Regions of Burkina Faso

description.narrative: The project responds to the need to strengthen social cohesion between host communities and displaced populations of the Center North and Sahel regions in Burkina Faso. With the aim to carry out activities to help prevent or reduce existing tensions and to strengthen social cohesion between communities, through this project, IOM focuses on placing the public administration at the center of the process in a logic of national and local ownership. The initiative responds to youth problems by bringing together young people from different communities around joint micro-projects selected by the public administration and implemented by micro-grants delivered to youth. Effective communication around the good practices of such young incubators are intended to create multiplier effects at the local and national levels to build and consolidate peace and social cohesion between communities. The project also includes awareness raising and training activities on COVID-19 and other sensitization activities to prepare the population to prevent these risks and avoid potential reject from host communities that could exacerbate vulnerabilities.

title.narrative: UN Joint-Project to Address Cooking Fuel Needs, Environmental Degradation and Food Security for Populations Affected by the Refugee Crisis: Safe Access to Fuel and Energy (SAFE) Plus - SIDA

description.narrative: Through this project, IOM aim is to contribute to the overall food and nutrition security, empowerment and resilience of households in Cox’s Bazar (Bangladesh). To achieve this, the project has four objectives, the first of which is to address the urgent cooking fuel needs of the Rohingya and host communities by providing Liquid Petroleum Gas. The second objective focuses on livelihoods activities for host communities—strengthening social cohesion, livelihoods and income generation for the heavily impacted host community through training and input provision; the third objective aims to reduce negative environmental impacts through land/forest rehabilitation. The fourth objective aims at increasing income generation by increasing agricultural production and marketing. To adapt to COVID-19, this project is reprogramming through cash transfers to host community households and adjustments to procurement, distribution, and planting for rice and forestry activities.

title.narrative: Disaster Resilience in the Compact Nations (RESILIENCE)

description.narrative: This project aims at supporting to national and state task forces on developing and implementing risk communication and community engagement plans related to the COVID-19 response in the Federated States of Micronesia and Republic of the Marshall Islands. In the Federal States of Micronesia, this includes the provision of technical guidance, production and distribution of national outreach campaigns, and facilitating online trainings for health workers using WHO standards; support to points of entry (POE) activities, including the improvement of infrastructure, procurement of safety and communication equipment to improve surveillance, and facilitating online trainings on screening and managing travelers for border and immigration officers. In the Republic of the Marshall Islands, this project responds to the overall planning and coordination activities of government counterparts, including by providing technical and resource support to emergency operations centers and national response planning efforts; improving communication pathways through communication equipment, trainings, and expanded risk communication and community engagement; and supporting POE measures through the development of standard operating procedures, quality assurance and quality control mechanisms, monitoring and evaluation and reporting mechanisms, as well as hygiene and infrastructure improvements.
